org.vesselonline.test
Class WebSession

java.lang.Object
  org.vesselonline.test.WebSession

public class WebSession
extends java.lang.Object

Represents the information needed to describe an HTTP session as described in the jWebUnitSiteDescription XML file.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Steven Handy
See Also:
WebSite

Constructor Detail

WebSession

public WebSession(java.lang.String cookieName,
                  java.lang.String cookieValue,
                  java.lang.String userName,
                  java.lang.String passwdElem)
           throws java.io.IOException
Constructor for full session attributes. Prompts user in the console for the value of the login password.

Parameters:
cookieName - Name of the cookie that identifies the HTTP session.
cookieValue - Expected value of a valid cookie for an HTTP session.
userName - User account to utilize for sessions for this web site.
passwdElem - Name of the form text input field that will accept the password.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
Method Detail

getCookieName

public java.lang.String getCookieName()
Gets the name of the cookie identifying the site's HTTP session.

Returns:
Name of the cookie for the site's session.

getCookieValue

public java.lang.String getCookieValue()
Gets the expected value for a valid HTTP session for this site. Will be set if the username and password match to provide a successful login.

Returns:
Value of a cookie representing a valid session for this site.

getUserName

public java.lang.String getUserName()
Gets the username being utilized for testing for this site. Must match the password and cookie value to create a valid session.

Returns:
Name of a user to use when testing this site.

getPasswdElem

public java.lang.String getPasswdElem()
Gets the name of the password input field that will contain the password. This field should always be present when testing with jWebUnit, but will not show up after a user is authenticated during normal usage.

Returns:
Name of the password input field for this user's session.

getPassword

protected java.lang.String getPassword()
Gets the password for testing as entered by the test administrator. This value is protected so as to limit exposure to external programs, however, a test account should always be used, and then discarded prior to deployment.

Returns:
Password for the user for testing this site.
